Great game, definitely a little bit short if you just want to beat it, but if you get all the achievements, it definitely adds a good amount of play time to the game. If the game is on sale, I think it's a must buy.
norm

Portal is a First-Person Puzzle Platformer that has the player solve levels that deal with portals. Not only will you use portals to reach certain areas, but you'll also have to consider momentum and timing to continue. The first few levels slowly let the player become familiar with the mechanics. The levels don't get too complicated towards the end, but there are additional challenges and custom levels that provide more content. There isn't much of a story, but things do become more interesting as the game progresses. The look and feel of the test chambers give off a clean and unsettling vibe. The lack of music for the majority of the game adds to the creepy atmosphere. I wouldn't say it's horrifying, but it does feel slightly off to me. The main campaign can be beaten in a short amount of time, compared to bigger games. However, I have played this years ago with The Orange Box and Portal: Still Alive on the Xbox 360, so that could have made it faster for me. Anyways, if you enjoy solving puzzles and like games that don't take too long to beat, then I'd check this out.
I like portal
It is so good all across the board and you need to definitely follow it up with Portal 2. It is seriously a phenomenal way to show the sci-fi genre in a video game. So. Good. 10/10 fs!

Jogo muito bom, mesmo dps de 15 anos continua com gráficos bonitos, a gameplay é bem legal e divertida, a história é legal e interessante ao mesmo tempo misteriosa, da pra jogar o game com ou sem prestar atenção na história, você pode jogar apenas como um game só de puzzle ou com uma história subentendida, a campanha principal é meio curta dependendo de quão inteligente você é pra passar os puzzles do game.
Os puzzle são bem interessantes e vão ficando mais difíceis ao decorrer do jogo e eles tem formas muito boas de passar que dependem de pensar um pouco.
A história é muito interessante e o final é magnífico e a música dos créditos é maravilhosa e a letra é algo que nos conecta mais com o jogo.

RESUMINDO:
O jogo vale muito a pena ser jogado, não possui bugs(eu não tive nehum), o final é espetacular.
The cake is indeed a lie, but this game isn't.

Expect to get ~4h of gameplay in the main campaign.

yoo i love portal 1. been playing it for years on console (not on ps3 tho cuz EA's port is wacker than all wack and there's no trophy and post-covid it costs like $100 CAD on ebay). i'd 11/10 recommend, especially if you've only played portal 2 and really enjoyed it. i'm super excited to play my 360 version on series x if i can actually buy one anytime soon... i mean i technically can right now on amazon but my lovely girlfriend would like me to get it on indigo so she can get 3k points which i totally understand and back, just means i gotta wait for a restock which can take 4-6 weeks. ANYWAY i'm passing the time happily playing it in 1200p 60fps on pc using the series x controller occasionally cause it has partial support tho the thumbstick keybinds to the mouse are kinda wack and it doesn't work that well plus playing with k+m is 1000 times better anyway but it's just that  i want that current gen console experience... if so i probably should be using a dualsense then instead huh... just i have a ps4 pro and the ps5 is impossible to get in canada for msrp and i just feel like switching it up. in conclusion , portal 1 is absolute fire and i definitely recommend it to anyone who loves puzzle games, first person shooters, physics games, the half-life world, sci-fi horror & a good time. - Chrisy T
